In addition. Active members with radio stations may use the facili¬
ties of the NAEB Radio Network upon payment of an annual assessment
fee. The Network distributes approximately eight hours of program¬
ming, by tape recording, weekly, to members subscribing to its ser¬
vice, This fee is also based on power (with the same power classi¬
fications as membership) and a new station does not have to pay the
full fee until the third year it is in the Network, The fees are:
1st year
250,00
150.00
2nd year
O660.6O
375.00
225.00
3rd year
OTTOT
500.00
300.00
Class A
Class B
Class C
Stations must also pay postage both ways on the tapes shipped to
and from Network Headquarters here in Urbana, Illinois. Still even
a Class A station paying its full third-year rate is paying only a
little over $2,00 an hour for better than hOO hours of programming
from the Network in a year. This is about the most inexpensive
programming a station can do.
If, after looking over the materials which we shall send you, you
have further questions, we shall be most happy to answer them.
Sincerely,
Harold E, Hill
Associate Director
